image.altText: Three children: JayBird Byrne, Lani and Luca.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australian kids experience 'school can't'. For these families, finding a system that works has transformed their child's life.

title.children: These are all 'school can't' kids, but they're thriving in different ways

image.altText: Man with closed eye displays eye injury.

props.synopsis: It had just passed 10pm on Friday night when Bronny Walsh took a call from her son who said he had been assaulted while working as a bus driver in Launceston. She is now calling for change.

title.children: 'He's traumatised': Call for change after youths allegedly attack Launceston bus driver

image.altText: An older man with glasses leans on a post while wearing a life jacket. He speaks to another man in a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: For the second week running, a national leader has waded into the murky political waters of salmon farming in Macquarie Harbour. But Prime Minister Anthony Albanese didn't come with any big statements.

title.children: What should Tasmanians make of Anthony Albanese's west coast trip?

image.altText: Santa sits on a dunny on a roadside sculpture.

props.synopsis: Santa's sleigh being pulled by dirt bikes. Santa on a tractor. Santa sitting on a dunny, with an elf alongside. The roadside Christmas displays in this very out-of-the-way town are worth the trip.

title.children: Tiny Tassie town puts itself 'on the map' with festive displays

image.altText: Family members descend stairs outside a red brick building with green trees.

props.synopsis: Parents Georgina Burt and Andrew Dodt are the lead plaintiffs on a newly launched class action against the state of Tasmania and the operator of the Hillcrest jumping castle.

title.children: 'Our clients are absolutely heartbroken': Families launch class action over jumping castle tragedy

image.altText: Supermaxis Wild Thing 100 and LawConnect sail through Sydney Harbour in a race

props.synopsis: Grant Wharington has declared his supermaxi Wild Thing 100 a better chance of winning the Sydney to Hobart on handicap than claiming the line honours prize usually contested by boats her size.

title.children: Wild Thing 100 skipper eyes Sydney to Hobart handicap crown

image.altText: Rob McEwan looks over with plans for construction laid out on a desk in an office.

props.synopsis: After workers dug up two skeletons at a Hobart school's hockey field it was believed there'd likely be more. But the scale of what the archaeological team found was staggering.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ Nearly 2,000 bodies found under school's sporting field, in what is believed to be Australia's biggest exhumation

image.altText: The silhouettes of a military vehicle and soldier against an orange sunset sky along the Gaza border.

props.synopsis: Hamas, Israel and the United States have indicated a deal could be close that would allow for the first truce between the warring sides since late last year.

title.children: Optimism as Israel and Hamas hold 'serious and positive' truce talks

image.altText: Two men whose faces are obscured walk up to a nurse's station at a hospital.

props.synopsis: Mike* has an acquired brain injury and schizoaffective disorder, he is also the recipient of an NDIS plan worth $660,000 a year â€” making him a lucrative catch for unscrupulous providers.Â

title.children: Family of NDIS participant fears he's been 'kidnapped' for $670k plan

image.altText: Generic photo of people swimming in the ocean at an Adelaide beach on a hot day.

props.synopsis: Christmas Day is looking dry and sunny for most of the country, with a distinctive lack of rain-producing low-pressure systems, troughs or cold fronts appearing on the charts.

title.children: Warm Christmas Day forecast for most of Australia with heatwave to follow

image.altText: A line-up of cars on a road that is partially underwater.

props.synopsis: The dams are spilling, the ground is sodden and more is rain on the way for parts of Queensland, so is it time to fear another major flood event?

title.children: Queenslanders urged not to panic but prepare for possible floods

image.altText: Hands holding bottle of ArmaForce.

props.synopsis: Australia's Therapeutic Goods Administration has an ongoing investigation into a key ingredient of ArmaForce, which is believed to have triggered several adverse reactions.

title.children: Popular cold and flu treatment ArmaForce under investigation by TGA

image.altText: Woman sitting in room with blue background

props.synopsis: A mother of two is calling for better training of psychologists after her ex-partner confessed to wanting to kill himself and their children.

title.children: Mother claims therapist ignored ex-husband's filicide warning signs

image.altText: Pat Cummins walks off the Gabba with his teammates behind him

props.synopsis: Australia arrived at the Gabba on day four needing to force the issue for everything to fall their way for a victory to be snatched, but as the misfortunes piled up the day quickly came to represent a missed opportunity.

title.children: On a day Australia needed everything to go right, too much went wrong

image.altText: The region spanning the sky from the constellation of Sagittarius (the Archer) to Scorpius (the Scorpion).

props.synopsis: A group of international researchers discover a binary star orbiting near a supermassive black hole at the centre of our galaxy, the Milky Way.

title.children: Binary star found orbiting supermassive black hole at galaxy's centre

image.altText: Brunette haired woman with bandage over missing nose

props.synopsis: In Australia, anyone needing a facial prosthetic, such as a nose or ear, must pay for it themselves. However, those below the neck can be paid for through government funding or private health insurance.

title.children: Cancer survivors facing 'debilitating' stigma fight for prosthetics funding

image.altText: Several people sleeping and lying on floor in prison

props.synopsis: Under proposed law changes, drug users in Indonesia could be sent to rehabilitation centres instead of prison. But legal experts say the change will simply shift a problem.

title.children: Indonesia signals shift in penalties for drug users

image.altText: Close-up of a green Medicare card with a calculator and money in the background

props.synopsis: Last year, the government tripled bulk-billing incentives for some people, but doctors did not claim all the benefits. Here's why.

title.children: GPs leave $140 million in Medicare incentives unclaimed

image.altText: A ship in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Japanese officials claim their Mogami frigate is faster, stealthier and better suited to operate alongside the United States than a rival warship offering from Germany.

title.children: Faster and stealthier: Japan's pitch to clinch $10bn Australian warship prize

image.altText: A happy family smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A dying Queensland mother living with cystic fibrosis has again cheated death with a heart and double lung transplant.

title.children: Queensland mother on transplant list six hours before life-saving call

image.altText: Debris and corrugated iron sheeting cluttering a street alongside damaged buildings

props.synopsis: More than 200 Red Cross humanitarian workers are feared missing in the wake of the worst cyclone to hit the French territory of Mayotte in 90 years.

title.children: Cyclone Chido death toll rises as Red Cross volunteers feared missing

image.altText: Police in hazmat suits in bushland investigating.

props.synopsis:
The second body has been found near where a 33-year-old woman's remains were discovered wrapped in a plastic bag near Sydney Airport last week.Â 
Â

title.children: Police treating discovery of second body in Botany as 'targeted double murder'

image.altText: Alyssa Healy after hitting a ball in the air, as she watches to see where it will land in a cricket match

props.synopsis: Alyssa Healy could be given until the last moment to be selected for the Australia team for their first match of the Rose Bowl series against New Zealand.

title.children: Australia to leave Healy decision late ahead of first game against NZ

image.altText: drone view of a cotton field

props.synopsis: Grapes, cotton and grains are blooming out of Queensland's desert red dirt, prompting the beginning of a brand new industry. But can the dusty outback become more than just grazing land?

title.children: Unexpected crops rising among cows and bulls on cattle country

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at a press conference in brisbane

props.synopsis: Details of the coming promise to voters, which follows months of consultation with the gas industry, are being calibrated to counter Labor's likely strategy of ongoing direct-to-households energy bill relief.

title.children: Dutton to revive Morrison's 'gas-fired recovery' in election pledge to cut energy bills

image.altText: By the beach is a girl with hair past her shoulders wearing circular sunnies and holding an electric guitar pointing to the sky.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australian kids experience 'school can't'. For these families, finding a system that works has transformed their child's life.

title.children: These are all 'school can't' kids, but they're thriving in different ways

image.altText: The red Qantas kanmgaroo logo seen on the tail of a white Boeing 767 plane on a background of a blue sky

props.synopsis: Qantas and the Transport Workers Union have agreed to set up a compensation fund for payments to be sent to 1,820 impacted former employees who were outsourced by the airline.

title.children: Qantas agrees to $120m in compensation for illegally sacked workers

image.altText: Jacob and Helen smile at the camera while Helen puts her arm around her son

props.synopsis: A specialised dental service is helping to fill a big cavity in an industry that has been largely inaccessible for people with disability. For Jacob, 20, it has been life changing.Â

title.children: For people living with disability, accessing a dentist can be a challenge

image.altText: Snoop Dogg wears sunglasses and holds his fingers together as if smoking.

props.synopsis: It's been 31 years since Snoop Dogg and Dr. Dre teamed up on the former's debut. Their latest reunion doesn't quite hit as hard.Â

title.children: After 30 years, Snoop pulls Dr. Dre back in to produce his new album

image.altText: A close up of a man wearing a suit speaking.

props.synopsis: The university sector is preparing for a controversial visa processing direction to be replaced before the end of the year despite the education minister previously vowing it would remain in place until international student caps could be enforced.

title.children: Controversial international student direction expected to be replaced

image.altText: Man smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Japanese authorities had issued an international warrant for Paul Watson's arrest earlier this year, alleging he injured a Japanese ship's crew member with a stink bomb in 2010.

title.children: Sea Shepherd founder released from detention in Greenland

image.altText: A blue Meta logo placed on the keyboard of a silver laptop

props.synopsis: Facebook's parent company has agreed to a landmark payment over the Cambridge Analytica privacy scandal.

title.children: Meta agrees to pay Australian Facebook users in $50 million settlement

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: New Treasury figures show the top tenth of earners are hauling in tens of billions of dollars from tax concessions and loopholes.

title.children: One million Australians are negatively gearing, new tax figures show

image.altText: A young man with short cropped hair and a neck tattoo wears a blue football jersey.

props.synopsis: Premier League club Chelsea issues a brief statement confirming an investigation into Ukrainian international Mykhailo Mudryk after an adverse result from a urine sample.

title.children: Chelsea's Mykhailo Mudryk returns adverse result on anti-doping test

image.altText: Two men in suits smiling, while holding glasses of wine and looking at each other

props.synopsis: Ukraine's military intelligence agency and the Pentagon say about 30 North Korean troops were killed or wounded during a battle with the Ukrainian army.Â

title.children: First North Korean deaths reported in Russia-Ukraine conflict
